Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Money-making \Mon"ey-mak`ing\, n. The act or process of making money; the acquisition and accumulation of wealth. [1913 Webster]
Obstinacy in money-making. --Milman. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Money-making \Mon"ey-mak`ing\, a. 1. Affording profitable returns; lucrative; as, a money-making business. Opposite of {unprofitable}. [1913 Webster]
2. Successful in gaining money, and devoted to that aim; as, a money-making man. [1913 Webster]

moneymaking adj 1: producing a good profit; "a remunerative business" [syn: {lucrative}, {remunerative}] 2: profit oriented; "a commercial book"; "preached a mercantile and militant patriotism"- John Buchan; "a mercenary enterprise"; "a moneymaking business" [syn: {mercantile}, {mercenary}, {moneymaking(a)}] n : the act of making money (and accumulating wealth)
